article.description: Green, Holy Cross defense smothers Hartford 80-55
article.headline: Green, Holy Cross defense smothers Hartford 80-55
article.linkText: Green, Holy Cross defense smothers Hartford 80-55
article.story: UNCASVILLE, Conn. -- Eric Green scored a career-high 18 points and a dominating defensive effort propels Holy Cross to 80-55 win over Hartford in the Hall of Fame Tip-Off tournament Sunday night. The Crusaders (3-3) set the tone for the game early on defense, holding Hartford (2-5) to a single point in the first 11 minutes of play and limiting the Hawks to a single field goal in the first half. Hartford scored their first field goal on an Oren Faulk layup with 3:11 remaining in the half to make the score 26-10. The Hawks made their second field goal of the game when Corban Wroe sank a 3-pointer with 16:27 remaining in the second half. Hartford would finish the night shooting 15 of 40 from the field. Mark Nwakamma and Yolonzo Moore II sank back to back 3-pointers to pull the Hawks to within 49-28, but the Crusaders responded with an 11-0 run to go up by 32 with 8:52 remaining.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
